data:
T1: Primary tumor size <= 2 cm
T2: Primary tumor size > 2 cm and <= 5 cm
T3: Primary tumor size > 5 cm
T4: Primary tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin
T stage is determined based on the largest dimension of the invasive carcinoma
In situ carcinoma does not influence the T stage
When multiple tumors are present, the size of the largest tumor should be used to determine the T stage

T1: Primary tumor size is equal to or less than 2 cm
T2: Primary tumor size is greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm
T3: Primary tumor size is greater than 5 cm
T4: Primary tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin
T stage is determined based on the largest dimension of the invasive carcinoma
In situ carcinoma does not influence the T stage
When multiple tumors are present, the size of the largest tumor should be used to determine the T stage
The presence of vascular space invasion, calcification, or multifocality does not affect the T stage

T1: Primary tumor size is equal to or less than 2 cm
T2: Primary tumor size is greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm
T3: Primary tumor size is greater than 5 cm
T4: Primary tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin
T stage is determined based on the largest dimension of the invasive carcinoma
In situ carcinoma does not influence the T stage
When multiple tumors are present, the size of the largest tumor should be used to determine the T stage
The presence of vascular space invasion, calcification, or multifocality does not affect the T stage
For breast cancer, the T stage is based on the largest dimension of the invasive carcinoma and does not consider vascular invasion, calcification, or multifocality

pT1a: Tumor size is 0.1 to 0.5 cm
pT1b: Tumor size is 0.6 to 1 cm
pT1c: Tumor size is more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm

T1: Primary tumor size is equal to or less than 2 cm
T2: Primary tumor size is greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm
T3: Primary tumor size is greater than 5 cm
T4: Primary tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin

pT1a: Tumor size is 0.1 to 0.5 cm
pT1b: Tumor size is 0.6 to 1 cm
pT1c: Tumor size is more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm
The T stage is not affected by the presence of ductal carcinoma in situ, calcifications, or multifocality in breast cancer
The T stage is not affected by the closest distance of the tumor to the resection margins in breast cancer
